description: Request from Defence Construction Canada for the detailed testing programme
full_summary:
=====================================

**Title:** Request for Proposal for Detailed Testing Program at CFB Halifax, Nova Scotia

**Reference Number:** PW-22-01012459
**Publication Date:** November 3, 2022
**Issued Amendment Number:** 1
**Closed on:** December 13, 2022, at 2:00 PM AST
** Tender Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
**Legal Instruments:** World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
**Professional Services:** Detailed Testing Program (Sediment Sampling and Underwater Habitat Survey)

**Background and Objective:**

This Request for Proposal seeks a consulting firm to provide professional services for a Detailed Testing Program (DTP) and an Underwater Habitat Survey (UHS) at the Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Halifax, in Nova Scotia. The successful proponent will work collaboratively with Defence Construction Canada to identify and assess environmental conditions associated with sediment sampling and underwater habitat. The evaluation criteria will focus on experience, expertise, methodology, and personnel.

**одавність및experience Constraints:**

A. Environmental Expertise
1\. Ability to interpret the environmental context of the project site
2\. Experience in conducting detailed sediment sampling
3\. Familiarity with underwater habitat surveys

B. Technical Competence

\1\. Use of sound sampling methods to ensure accurate data
2\. Effective analysis and interpretation of data
3\. Identification of potential risks and mitigation measures

C. Personnel

\1\. Presence of experienced staff familiar with environmental assessments
2\. Ability to work in a team to deliver the program efficiently

**Access to the RFP and Proposal Requirements:**

The RFP package can be downloaded electronically from the MERX Electronic Bidding System. All technical questions and Communications should be addressed to Camille Attia, Contracting Officer, via.
